metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4303 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The parse_string function in cjson.c in the cJSON library mishandles UTF8/16 strings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a non-hex character in a JSON string, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow. It was discovered that iperf mishandled certain UTF8 and UTF16 strings. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-4303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iperf3 - 3.1.3-1
libiperf0 - 3.1.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iperf3 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.3-1').
